LeafGasExchange 1.1.0

    • Guide to use the LeafGasExchange package to simulate the photosynthesis

    Reference

    All functions

    f.A()

    Coupled conductance photosynthesis model

    f.AT()

    Coupled conductance photosynthesis model and energy balance model

    f.Aci()

    Photosynthesis model

    f.GPP()

    Canopy scale GPP calculation

    f.GPPT()

    Canopy scale GPP calculation, with leaf energy budget

    f.Norman.Radiation()

    Norman 1979 Radiation interception model Converted into a R code from the original code of Gordon Bonan: Bonan, G. (2019). Climate Change and Terrestrial Ecosystem Modeling. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. doi:10.1017/9781107339217

    f.VcmaxRef.LAI()

    Gradients of photosynthetic parameters

    f.arrhenius()

    Temperature dependence of Gamma star, Ko, Kc and Rd

    f.arrhenius.inv()

    Temperature dependence of Gamma star, Ko, Kc and Rd

    f.canopy.interception()

    Function to describe the light levels inside the canopy

    f.ci.treshold()

    Intercellular CO2 threshold between electron transport and carboxylation limitations

    f.ds()

    Leaf to air water vapour pressure deficit calculation

    f.fitting()

    Fitting function for photosynthesis data (light curve or Aci curve)

    f.gs()

    Conductance model for stomata conductance to water vapour

    f.gsmax()

    Maximum theoretical stomatal conductance

    f.gsmin()

    Calculation of the minimal conductance given by a particular coupled conductance and photosynthesis model

    f.import_licor6400()

    Import Licor 6400 file

    f.import_licor6800()

    Import Licor 6800 file

    f.make.param()

    Photosynthesis and stomata model parameters

    f.modified.arrhenius()

    Temperature dependence of Jmax and Vcmax

    f.modified.arrhenius.inv()

    Temperature dependence of Jmax and Vcmax

    f.plot()

    Plot data and model

    f.smooth()

    Smoothing functions between photosynthesis limitations (for example between rubisco carboxylation and light limitation)

    f.tridiagonal.solver()

    Tridiagonal solver

    Contents

    Developed by Julien Lamour.
